node.title: A Light Was Kindled - Part 1
node.description: “At Wittenberg a light was kindled whose rays should extend to the uttermost parts of the earth, and which was to increase in brightness to the close of time.” (Great Controversy, p. 126) “The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.” (John 1:5) As long as the light shines the darkness does not, and cannot, overcome it. Turn the light on in a pitch dark- room, and the darkness is dispelled. But what happens if you turn out the light? This seminar theme will be developed by a combination of proclamation, lecture and personal testimony.
